text: Bartow is a town in Jefferson County, Georgia, United States. As of the 2020 census, the city had a population of 186. The town was originally named "Spier's Turnout", but was changed to honor the first Confederate officer to die in battle, Colonel Francis S. Bartow of Savannah, Georgia. ==References== Category:Towns in Georgia (U.S. state)
title: Bartow, Georgia
